it.unimi.dsi.law.rank
Class PageRankJacobi

java.lang.Object
  it.unimi.dsi.law.rank.PageRank
      it.unimi.dsi.law.rank.PageRankJacobi

public class PageRankJacobi
extends PageRank

Computes PageRank using the Jacobi method.

The general formula described in PageRank can be rewritten as

x' ( I - α ( P + du' ) ) = (1 − α)v'.

The system

x' M = b'
can be solved using the Jacobi method using the formula
xi(t+1) = ( bi − Σi≠j mji xj(t) ) ⁄ mii.

Substituting to M and to b' the corresponding terms present in the first formula, we obtain the following equation:

xi(t+1) = ( (1 − α) vi + α Σj≠i ( pji + uidj ) xj(t) ) ⁄ ( 1 − αpii − αuidi )

We can rearrange the formula so that the contribution of dangling nodes is computed separately:

xi(t+1)= ( (1 − α) vi + α ( Σj → i, j≠i pji xj(t) + κ ui ) ) ⁄ ( 1 − αpii − αuidi )
where κ is the sum of xj(t) over all the dangling nodes j ≠ i.

The attribute previousRank represents the ranking at the previous step.

clear

public void clear()
Clears all data. After calling this method, data about the last PageRank computations are cleared, and you should call again init() before computing PageRank again.
